meanings.definition: A substance that emits light when exposed to radiation.
meanings.sent1: The fluorescers in the paint made it glow in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use fluorescers to study cells under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous firefly swapped the fluorescers in the streetlights with glow sticks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a jar of fluorescers, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand was filled with fluorescers, creating a trail of light wherever it waved.

meanings.definition: Those who cause something to emit light when exposed to radiation.
meanings.sent1: The talented artists were the true fluorescers of the art exhibition.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were the fluorescers of hope during the dark times.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous firefly was the secret fluorescer behind the glowing streetlights.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like fluorescers, illuminating the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was a true fluorescer, inspiring her students to shine brightly.
